{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.14929v1", "title": "On the Exponential Diophantine Equation $(a^n-1)(b^n-1)=x^2$", "summary": "Let $a$ and $b$ be two distinct fixed positive integers such that $\min
\{a,b\}>1.$ First, we correct an oversight from \cite{X-Z}. Then, we show that
the equation in the title with $b \equiv 3 \pmod 8$, $b$ prime and $a$ even has
no solution in positive integers $n, x$. This generalizes a result of Szalay
\cite{L}.", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT", "published": "2025-04-21T07:50:51Z"}
